data.title: The Never-Ending Reason 99% Loved Top Gun: Maverick
data.meta_description: Top Gun: Maverick smashed box office records — $300 million in its first weekend, now likely to hit $600 million. Ninety-nine percent love the film — but why?
data.text:
Divided No More? Why are Americans reunited in their love for the return of a real heroic, feel-good film?

Joseph Serwach

·

Follow

Published in

The Narrative

·

4 min read

·

Jun 9, 2022

--

Top Gun: Maverick smashed box office records — $300 million in its first weekend, now likely to hit $600 million. Ninety-nine percent love the film — but why?

You’ve probably read the seven most common arguments:

Tom Cruise is the last true movie star. “It couldn’t have been anyone else,” The New York Times reported.

We waited nearly 34 years for the sequel to his most famous film. Then, finally, generations grew up with the original. “They don’t make movies like this anymore.”

It’s better and more popular than the beloved original. The original was a great classic. This one came to fruition over decades just in time for a world crying for values.

It’s a family film all can enjoy. You can take your kids, your grandpa, everyone and anyone, and they’ll find something to like.

It’s a wholesome return to a genuinely patriotic American film. There’s a reason Turner Classic Movies can charge a premium over modern cinema.

After decades of flawed anti-heroes? Top Gun brings back…
